keyFacts: A Miami Herald article published on November 28, 2018, critically examines the non-prosecution agreement given to Jeffrey Epstein, implicating former U.S. Attorney Alexander Acosta.
Federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York became aware of the article and discussed it internally via email on the same day it was published.
The prosecutors' reaction included shock ('WTF?') and a strategic discussion on how to 'pursue this' matter, indicating the article prompted internal review or action.
The email chain shows coordination between at least two Assistant United States Attorneys, with one mentioning being at the 'JTTF' (Joint Terrorism Task Force) until noon.
The subject line and forwarded message indicate the article's title was the primary catalyst for the discussion among the prosecutors.
